title.rendered: Read books without sleeping pills: PM

content.rendered:
Dhaka: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina asked to read books instead of taking medicine for sleep.

He said, everyone should have the habit of reading.It is better if parents teach it from childhood. Many people take medicine for sleep, there is no need. Reading a book makes me sleepy. If you read more interesting books, you won’t fall asleep again. For this you have to select the book again.

He said this at the opening ceremony of the Amar Ekushey Book Fair on Thursday (February 1) afternoon.

The Prime Minister said that many people read books in digital format. Language and literature should keep pace with the times. Digital and audio media should be added to the publication. If we keep pace with the times, we will move forward.

He said, translation should be enriched. The habit of reading should be developed from childhood. Bengali literature should be delivered to the world court. Bangla Academy is the source of many movements. There is a need to think how to organize the book fair in a big place.


I used to come to book fairs since my school days. Coming to the book fair as Prime Minister is no fun. He also mentioned that freedom has been lost in the security fence.

Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said that after Digital Bangladesh, the government’s goal is Smart Bangladesh. So everything including language literature should be made smart.

The Prime Minister requested the publishers to become not only paper but also digital publishers. Sheikh Hasina also emphasized on digital publishing to keep pace with the times.

He also said that libraries will have audio versions, but there is a need for audio versions. If that is also the benefit of many people, they will know if they listen, we should take that measure as well. This is the most important thing, we will move forward to keep pace with the times.

Earlier, he handed over the awards to the winners of the 2023 Bangla Academy Literary Awards. Bangla Academy Literary Awards were given to 16 people in 11 categories for their contribution to literature.

The Prime Minister reached the Bangla Academy premises around 3 pm.
